decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and removing threats from the board using cards like Dovin's Veto, Absorb, Banishing Light, and Shatter the Sky. It also utilizes card draw and selection with Omen of the Sea and Thirst for Meaning to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with The Birth of Meletis and Castle Ardenvale, while utilizing Thassa's Intervention for versatility. Dream Trawler provides a win condition and Castle Vantress helps to manipulate the top of the library.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board by utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven to create a recurring loop of sacrificing and dealing damage to the opponent's creatures. The deck also uses cards like Trail of Crumbs and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King acts as a strong finisher by drawing cards and growing in power with each sacrifice. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by maintaining board control and generating card advantage while dealing chip damage with sacrifice triggers.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage efficiently and end the game quickly. Cards like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Runaway Steam-Kin fuel the deck's aggressive strategy, while Embercleave and Castle Embereth provide additional power to close out games. By maintaining pressure and controlling the board with burn spells like Shock and Light Up the Stage, the deck seeks to maintain a high tempo and take advantage of its opponents to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressively utilizing sacrifice mechanics to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By consistently sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones with cards such as Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven, the deck can trigger powerful effects like Mayhem Devil and Midnight Reaper. Additionally, cards like Claim the Firstborn and The Akroan War further allow for disruption and control over the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of pressure and disruption to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans using a combination of Fires of Invention and Teferi, Time Raveler. Fires of Invention allows you to cast spells for free, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides bounce and disruption. The deck also includes various Cavaliers and Sphinx of Foresight to provide card advantage and additional control options. The deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant board position and close out the game with powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal, and board wipes while generating card advantage. The key strategy revolves around stalling the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Dream Trawler, eventually closing out the game with a powerful threat. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent's resources by maximizing card draw and efficient removal spells. With a mix of control elements and win conditions, this deck seeks to dominate the battlefield and outlast the opponent in a slow and methodical manner.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with small, aggressive white creatures while gaining life and utilizing abilities that synergize with lifegain. It includes powerful cards like Ajani, Strength of the Pride and Heliod, Sun-Crowned to boost the board presence and resilience of the creatures. The strategy revolves around efficiently building up a wide board presence and utilizing the lifegain abilities to outpace the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck is designed to apply constant pressure and establish dominance in the earlier stages of the game.

This Red Deck Wins Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures like Scorch Spitter and Tin Street Dodger, using them in combination with burn spells like Shock and Infuriate to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes powerful finishers like Embercleave and Phoenix of Ash to close out the game quickly. The goal is to establish early pressure and maintain aggression throughout the game, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck focuses on using Wilderness Reclamation and powerful instant/sorcery spells to control the game. By generating mana with Wilderness Reclamation, the deck can cast multiple spells in a turn, drawing cards, countering threats, and wiping the board with Storm's Wrath. The deck also utilizes creatures like Uro and Hydroid Krasis to gain life and draw cards, while also providing a clock for the opponent. Gadwick, the Wizened offers card draw and tap-down effects, while Brazen Borrower provides versatility with its bounce and flash abilities. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with its control elements.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn without paying their mana cost. By using card advantage and removal spells, it aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. The deck includes powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Kenrith, the Returned King to finish the game once control is established. With a mix of counter spells, card draw, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent in a game of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, aggressive white creatures known as "weenies." By utilizing cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Ajani, Strength of the Pride to buff and support the creatures, as well as gaining life from triggers like Ajani's Pridemate, this deck aims to build a strong board presence and apply pressure early in the game. Supporting cards like Tomik, Distinguished Advokist and Giant Killer provide additional utility and disruption to further enhance the deck's aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of this Temur Control deck is to control the game by ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, while also using cards like Thassa's Intervention and Gadwick, the Wizened to draw cards and counter opponent's spells. The deck also has removal spells like Storm's Wrath and Brazen Borrower to deal with threats. The goal is to maintain control of the board and out-value the opponent until you can close out the game with powerful finishers like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Expansion / Explosion.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through value-generating cards like Trail of Crumbs and Cauldron Familiar, while also utilizing powerful control cards like Casualties of War and Murderous Rider. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through sacrificing and recurring creatures. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King serves as a finisher, growing in power with each sacrifice. By leveraging a mix of removal spells, creature threats, and card advantage engines, this Jund Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy match-up.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with powerful creatures like Risen Reef, Omnath, and Cavalier of Thorns, while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa. Thassa, Deep-Dwelling helps to repeatedly bounce key creatures for extra value. Agent of Treachery can steal opponents' permanents and swing the game in your favor. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and powerful ETB effects, while utilizing the card advantage and ramp provided by the various land and creature abilities.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and board wipes to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes card draw and a versatile planeswalker in Teferi to gain card advantage and tempo. The win condition is through a combination of planeswalkers, enchantments, and powerful creatures like Dream Trawler. The deck aims to control the game tempo, maintain card advantage, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while keeping the opponent's board clear of threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice mechanics and aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven, the deck can trigger effects from Mayhem Devil and Midnight Reaper to deal damage and draw cards respectively. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and disruption while creating value through sacrificing creatures. Additionally, cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Claim the Firstborn provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan.
